page.title: 16NORTH WALES HOSPITAL
page.content: The{North Wales Hospital}for the mentally ill is a major employer in the town but often causes concern amongst the local community.A special secure unit for those with criminal tendencies has brought adverse reactions from the general public, especially regarding security arrangements.However the majority of the townsfolk adopt an understanding and helpful approach towards the patients. The hospital serves mainly Clwyd with some patients coming from Gwynedd and Cheshire.The new trend is away from centralisation with patients being catered for within their own community. Longterm patients occupy their time with rehabilitation programmes, organised leisure activities and occupational therapy.
